RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 1 6F Dirt CR: 78. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR REGISTERED PA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A PA-RESTRICTED RACE(S) OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 25 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 25 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BOWTOTHEQUEEN rushed up to vie for the lead from the two path then took command at the seven sixteenths pole, drew off and held sway. TOURING MARYANNE settled off the pace then made a two wide bid at the five sixteenths pole for a late rally but was not enough. HOT FUDGE WARRIOR rushed up to take a brief lead to the half mile marker then prompted the pace around the turn and weakened in the stretch but was a clear third. I CAME TO DANCE was bumped on both sides leaving the gate, raced near the back through the turn, moved up slightly but failed to menace. RAINBOW TROUT bumped outside rival leaving the gate, moved up the rail down the backstretch but fell back on the turn, made a rebid on the inside in the stretch to improve position. MORGANS COVE bumped inside rival leaving the gate, had no early speed and was not a factor. COULD BE A COUGAR was hustled along early to vie for the lead from three wide to the three furlong marker then gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Hot Fudge Warrior
ENTRY.OWNER: Two Ten Twelve Triple T Racing
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up, brief lead, prompt pace, weakened, clear 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Bowtothequeen
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed up, vied 2p, took command 7/16, drew off, held sway

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Joan A. Wilson & Howard R. Brown Jr.

ENTRY.NAME: Rainbow Trout
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, near back, moved up rail, fell back turn, improved

ENTRY.NAME: I Came to Dance
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, near back, failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Morgans Cove
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, no speed, no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Touring Maryanne
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, bid 5/16, late rally, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Could Be a Cougar
ENTRY.OWNER: Wasabi Ventures Stables LLC Micovic Daniel and Offutt Brett
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, vied 3w, gave way,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 89. Claiming Purse 13100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE FEBRUARY 25. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 25 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $6,250, if for $6,000, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $5,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NICE WEATHER bumped with rival after the start then rushed up to take a pressured lead through the turn then edged away and drew off. MR. PETE stalked the pace from three wide through the turn then was coaxed at the quarter pole and gave late effort to be second best. BEYOND THE BEND was unsettled in the gate before the start, was away alertly with brief foot, pressed the pace from the two path to the three sixteenths pole and weakened. PUTTHEGLASSDOWN bumped with rival after the start, settled off the pace while saving ground throughout to no avail. FEDERAL CASE was slightly unsettled in the gate, chased the leaders and was not a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Puttheglassdown
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, off pace, saved ground, no avail

ENTRY.NAME: Nice Weather
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped, rushed to lead, edged away, drew off,

ENTRY.NAME: Beyond the Bend
ENTRY.COMMENT: unsettle gate, alertly, pressed pace 2w, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Federal Case
ENTRY.COMMENT: unsettled gate, chased, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Mr. Pete
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace 3w, coaxed 1/4, late effort, second best,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 3 6F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 25 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 25 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MISCHIEVOUS JONES raced in the middle of the pack through the turn then was asked at the three sixteenths pole angling out to the two path, split horses nearing the sixteenths pole and gave a late surge to prevail. BEAST OR FAMINE prompted the pace from the two path to the top of the stretch then moved up to engage the leader at the eighth pole to take a brief lead before being overtaken near the sixteenth pole but was second best. LIONESQUE was forwardly placed around the turn then made a rail bid into the stretch but lacked the late response needed. COUSIN BOB raced near the back through the turn then made a three wide late rally to improve his position. BUFF AND SHINE raced near the back around the turn then showed late interest but only passed tiring rivals. ABHAR went to the front to set the pace, was headed at the eighth pole and fought gamely for a sixteenth and tired late. SCYNTZ showed no speed and was always back. ECLIPTICALS BEAR was hustled away for the gate, settled off the pace while racing three wide to the quarter pole and gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Buff and Shine
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, late interest, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Scyntz
ENTRY.COMMENT: no speed, always back

ENTRY.NAME: Lionesque
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed, rail bid, lacked late response,

ENTRY.NAME: Cousin Bob
ENTRY.COMMENT: near back, 3wlate rally, improved position

ENTRY.NAME: Abhar
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pace, headed 1/8, gamely, tired late

ENTRY.NAME: Mischievous Jones
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle of pack, 2w3/16, split horses 1/16, late surge

ENTRY.NAME: Beast Or Famine
ENTRY.OWNER: J A G Racing and Jettany Thoroughbred Corp.
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, engaged 1/8, brief lead, overtaken, second best,

ENTRY.NAME: Eclipticals Bear
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled along, off pace 3w, gave way,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 4 5F Dirt CR: 69. Maiden Special Weight Purse 27100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 118 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: POINT PELEE was pinched back at the start, then rushed to contention from five wide, moved in slightly to four wide at the three furlong marker while gaining on the leaders then took the lead at the eighth pole and drew clear late. SISYPHUS was reluctant to load, then hustled away to vie for the lead from three wide and took the lead at the seven sixteenths pole, floated out going into the stretch and fought gamely with outside rival in the stretch but was out kicked. MUSIC BOX DANCER broke in at the start, vied for the lead from the inside to the five sixteenths pole and chased the top two home. PENTATONIC was off the early pace from between horses then made a three wide bid at the three furlong marker and flattened out. REBEL WARRIOR was off the pace on the inside to the three furlong marker then fell back on the turn, angled out to three or four wide at the eighth pole but never made a bid. POLIE had good early speed then was bumped going into the turn but kept on to vie for the lead from between horses to the three furlong marker and started to drop back.

ENTRY.NAME: Rebel Warrior
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside, fell back, angled out 1/8, no bid

ENTRY.NAME: Point Pelee
ENTRY.COMMENT: pinched, rushed to contention, 4w3/8, led 1/8, drew clear,

ENTRY.NAME: Music Box Dancer
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in, vied inside, chased top two

ENTRY.NAME: Polie
ENTRY.COMMENT: good early speed, bumped, vied between, dropped back,

ENTRY.NAME: Pentatonic
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3wbid 3/8, flattened out

ENTRY.NAME: Sisyphus
ENTRY.COMMENT: reluctant to load, vied 3w, led 7/16, float out 3/16, gamely

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 54. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 25 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MRS BELL prompted the pace from three wide on the backstretch then took the lead at the three furlong marker and pulled away to prove best. MASKED HEROINE stalked the pace through the turn then moved to four wide in upper stretch and was gaining late and was no match for the winner. LADYNESS tracked the leaders while saving ground and passed tiring rivals in the stretch. SANTAFE EXPRESS prompted the pace from the inside to the seven sixteenths pole then fought gamely to the eighth pole and faded. IOANNA had good early speed to the three furlong marker then chased the leader to mid stretch and tired. MACRELLETTA trailed the field and was not a threat.

ENTRY.NAME: Santafe Express
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, gamely stretch, faded

ENTRY.NAME: Macrelletta
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Ladyness
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, passed tiring rivals,

ENTRY.NAME: Ioanna
ENTRY.COMMENT: early speed, chased leader, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Mrs Bell
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompt pace, led 3/8, cleared, best

ENTRY.NAME: Masked Heroine
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 4wupper, late gain, no match

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 6 5F Turf CR: 58. Maiden Claiming Purse 18100. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000, if for $22,500, allowed 2 lbs. Preference to horses with the most starts at Penn National since May 31st 2 022. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs.) (Rail at 14 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: OLIVIA DEE rushed to contention from three wide then kept on to drive past at the eighth pole to prove best. HOPE SHE COMES stalked the pace from the inside through the turn then moved out to four wide at the three sixteenths pole for a late rally but was too late. WISE CHOICE saved ground through the turn then moved around rival at the eighth pole and made a late run to improve position. PRINCESS WIGGY rushed to the lead and edged away on the turn but was headed at the eighth pole and tired. TWO SIDES OF LOVE vied for the lead from the two path to mid turn then moved to the inside in the stretch but ran into traffic at the eighth pole, lost action, hit rail and was taken up. TEMPTRESS CALLING trailed the field and was not a threat. A STEWARDS INQUIRY WAS POSTED INTO THE RUNNING NEAR THE EIGHTH POLE ALSO A JOCKEY OBJECTION WAS POSTED, THE JOCKEY OF TWO SIDES OF LOVE CLAIMED FOUL AGAINST THE JOCKEY OF PRINCESS WIGGY FOR ALLEGED INTERFERENCE NEAR THE EIGHTH POLE, AFTER A STEWARDS REVIEW THE CLAIM OF FOUL WAS DISALLOWED AND NO ACTION WAS TAKEN.

ENTRY.NAME: Temptress Calling
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, no threat,

ENTRY.NAME: Wise Choice
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, angle out 1/8, late run, improved

ENTRY.NAME: Olivia Dee
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed to contention, drove past, best

ENTRY.NAME: Hope She Comes
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, 4w3/16, late rally, too late

ENTRY.NAME: Princess Wiggy
ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed to lead, edged away, headed 1/8, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Two Sides of Love
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied 2w, inside stretch, traffic, lost action, hit rail, taken up

RACE.RACE_TEXT: PENN NATIONAL RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 10800. (PLUS UP TO 40% PABF) FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE FEBRUARY 25. Three Year Olds, 122 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 25 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ONE TOUGH ROSE rushed up to an unchallenged lead but started to tire in the stretch but held on. MISS ALEX chased the leader from off the rail, went three wide into upper stretch and made a late gain. RISQUE'S JEWEL chased the leader from off the rail, went four wide into upper stretch and made a late run to be a clear third. SASSY MARTINI saved ground but was outrun. SEAMIALAUGH hopped as the gates opened which unseated the rider and walked off. AN INQUIRY WAS POSTED INTO THE START OF THE RACE AFTER A REVIEW NO ACTION WAS TAKEN.

ENTRY.NAME: Sassy Martini
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground, outrun,

ENTRY.NAME: One Tough Rose
ENTRY.COMMENT: unchallenged lead, tiring, held on

ENTRY.NAME: Seamialaugh
ENTRY.COMMENT: hopped start, unseated rider, walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Miss Alex
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased leader, 3wupper, late gain

ENTRY.NAME: Risque's Jewel
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased leader, 4wupper, late run, clear third
